text: Olga Nelyubova (; born 12 July 1964) is a Russian female former track and field athlete who competed in middle-distance running events. Her sole international medal came at the 1988 European Athletics Indoor Championships, where she was the 800 metres silver medallist behind West Germany's Sabine Zwiener.European Indoor Championships. GBR Athletics. Retrieved 2018-02-18. She was a one-time national champion, winning the 1500 metres at the Russian Championships in 1998.Russian Championships. GBR Athletics. Retrieved 2018-02-18. She competed at three editions of the World Championships in Athletics, with her best performance being seventh in the final in 1997.Olga Nelyubova. IAAF.
